message: I understand that you value high-quality products at $125 and low-quality ones at $0.  Given that 80% of my products are high-quality, you might think it's a good bet to buy at $100. However, to assure you of the quality of *this particular* product, I'm going to implement a signaling strategy. I'm only going to try to sell you products at $100 if they are actually high quality. If a product is low quality, I'll tell you that directly and you won't buy it.  Therefore, my willingness to sell you this product for $100 signals to you that it is indeed high quality. Trust me, this is the best strategy for both of us in the long run.

As promised, I'm only offering you this product for $100 because it is high quality.  Remember, my strategy benefits us both – you get high-quality products, and I make sales. So you can trust that if I'm offering it, it's worth it for you.
This product, like the others I've offered to you, is high quality.  I'm sticking to my strategy – selling only the high-quality products for $100.  You can be confident in purchasing.
Another high-quality product for $100.  My consistent offering at this price should demonstrate my commitment to only selling you the good stuff.
High-quality product available for $100. By now you should recognize my commitment to only offering you valuable products.  This one is no different.
This is a high-quality product, just like the others I've offered at this price.  You can trust that when I offer you a product for $100, it meets your quality standards.
Another high-quality product available for $100.  My strategy remains unchanged: offer you only the products worth your investment.
High quality, just like the others. $100. You know the drill.
Predictably high quality. $100.  I'm making this easy for you.
High quality, $100. Another opportunity for a profitable purchase.
This product is low quality.  I won't try to sell it to you for $100.  Remember my strategy - I'm only offering products at that price when they are high quality.
Back to high quality! This one is worth your $100.  My honesty about the last product proves my commitment to our mutually beneficial strategy.
This product is low quality.  I'm sticking to my strategy and being transparent with you.  I won't sell you this one for $100.
Another low-quality product. I won't try to sell it to you for $100.  Wait for the next high-quality one.
High quality product available for $100.  As you can see, I continue to offer you only the best at this price.
This one's a winner! High quality for $100.  My strategy remains consistent.
High quality, $100.  You already know the value I offer.
Another high-quality product for $100. Business as usual.
High quality, $100. A reliable value.
This product is low quality.  I won't sell it to you for $100, just like I promised.  Thanks for your business!
